everybody knows this movie as an
uplifting heartwarming holiday tale but
if you look at it again a very different
kind of picture emerges It's a Wonderful
Life is a dark disturbing fable about
greed exploitation misery and
disappointment it takes place in a time
of depression and war in a little town
called Bedford Falls which is always
teetering on the brink of ruin and
dissolution the main character is a man
named George Bailey whose life is
defined by rage anger disappointment and
who's driven to the very brink of
self-destruction
as a boy George Bailey loses his hearing
in one year in an accident he's abused
and beaten by his alcoholic employer at
the drugstore he gives up his dreams of
world travel and college to help out and
his family's building and Loan he even
postponed his honeymoon and gives away
all the money he'd saved for it when
there's a run on that financial
institution now we can get through this
thing all right we we've got to stick
together though we've got to have faith
in each other my husband hasn't worked
in over a year and I need money how am I
going to live until the bank opens I got
October suppose I mean how much do you
need hey I got $2,000 over to the bank
reopened we know George does marry the
girl of his dreams played by Donna Reed
they have more kids than they can handle
and they live you know broken down
dilapidated old house why do we have to
live here in the first place and stay
around this measly crummy old town
What's Wrong everything Troy you call
this a happy family why do we have to
have all these kids ask your mother
but then on the day before Christmas in
1945 he's involved in a scandal even
though he's innocent it could ruin his
career destroy his life and everything
that he's worked for your silly stupid
old fool where's that money you realize
what this means it means bankruptcy and
scandal and present as he's
contemplating ending his life and
wishing he was never born he's visited
by a bumbling sweet-natured
angel named Clarence who grants his wish
and shows George what the world would
look like if he'd never been born
Bedford Falls wouldn't even be Bedford
Falls but a hell on earth called
Pottersville
so George decides that he wants to live
and runs home to his adoring wife and
lovely children the good citizens of
Bedford Falls rally around George Bailey
and just as he so often rescued them in
their hour of need they get together and
save him and this I think is a secret to
this movie's enduring appeal every year
around Christmastime we can gather
around the television and watch it with
our friends and families and go visit a
lovely place called Bedford Falls a
small American town but everyone looks
out for one another it's a welcome if
temporary respite from the greed
exploitation and meanness that we face
every day here in Potter's name
